name: Resort Cala di Falco

reviews.text: We stayed in one of the villas in the Cala di Falco complex. The villa was very spacious and we were able to use all the facilities of the hotel. Great kids club. Lovely pool although a few of the tiles around the edge were missing and were slightly rough! The drinks in the hotel are very expensive. We did hire a car and there is a supermarket within walking distance. The town is also within walking distance and has a great weekly market and some expensive shops too. There are numerous restaurants and bars.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.text: As we were staying in the villas, we never ate in the hotel, but the food looked good and in the evening tables were scattered around the pool area and looked very romantic. Nightly entertainment programme for both children and adults.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel for whole family

reviews.text: The beaches nearby are OK but please dont expect long sandy beaches.
reviews.title: Excellent family friendly holiday IF you stay in the villas

reviews.text: We travelled here for 1 week in July 2010. We had 3 children with us - aged 6,14 and 18. We stayed in an Il Borgo Junior suite. It had 2 bedrooms, 1 bathroom and 2 sofa beds in living area. There were 2 TVs though the picture on English channel was very poor. The rooms were very clean with an endless supply of clean towels each day. We were given beach towels and these too were exchanged after 3 days. The food in the hotel was excellent with a good choice for all our family. Pasta, pizza, daily roast, lots of fish dishes - even lobster - and loads of fresh fruit, vegetables and salad. The kids club was superb and our 6 year old loved it. Our eldest went scuba diving every day and was picked up by bus from the hotel. Not too much else for teenagers around the hotel though. The entertainment in the hotel was usually good and occasionally only average. The only slight complaint was the noise from the room above us when they woke in the morning. It did sound as if they were in our room. We would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Beautiful Island, great food, great people, expensive. Can't wait to go back

reviews.text: We stayed at the resort for the last 2 weeks in June and had a great time. Travelling with 2 children under 3 we decided to book a villa as it gave us flexibility on mealtimes, more space etc. Definately the right thing to do. Spoke to other families who were staying in the hotel who said that it did not cater very well for young children, no kettle in room to do bottles and one family was charged for everything in the minibar as they had taken things out to put kids food in.
reviews.title: Excellent for yound families, best thing was the food and children's facilities

reviews.text: We spent two weeks in a self-catering villa in August 2011, with our 2 1/2 year old son and some other family.
reviews.title: A great family holiday overall

reviews.text: Location: excellent spot to easily see the Costa Smerelda and surroundings, very centrally located. The beach in town is no good, but within 15 minutes drive you can go to Baia Sardinia or Capriciolli, both great beaches we went to. You need a car. Cannigione is ok, best bit is having dinner at the Tavola Azzura restaurant by the lovely church square, the prettiest bit of town.
reviews.title: personal touch was great

reviews.text: Hotel: pretty good pool area, though can get a bit crowded, need to secure a lounger early for it to be in the shade. Nice coffee/terrace area. The La Terrezza restaurant (not buffet) was very nice, we ate there one evening and it was very pleasant, there was also a great band playing. There was always some atmosphere in the evenings, enough people around. The children's playground was small but fine. The reception staff did their best to help. But our villa was only cleaned once in two weeks, which is shocking, really poor service for what we paid, that was really disappointing. But the amenities in the villa were good, the aircon worked, the outside seating area was nice. Definitely 4 star though, not 5 star. But it's a 4 star hotel, do there you go. I recommend Villa Giglio over Villa Mirto, Giglio is much bigger and better, with great outside space. Mirto is just ok.
reviews.title: Not as great as the owners obviously think it is

reviews.text: Kids club: Fantastic. Our son loved it there, the girls there were lovely. It was a great resource to have to give us a break!
reviews.title: Pleasant Hotel for a Low Key Holiday

reviews.text: Tips: we hired a boat for day and visited all around the Maddelena islands, absolutely beautiful, amazing clear blue bays and gorgeous beaches you can only reach by boat. Best part of the holiday for me. And great to have our own boat and driver, a luxury but completely worth every penny. And we loved the town on La Maddelenna island, it's really pretty (unlike a lot of the other towns there). We had lunch there a few times, it's an easy 15 minute ferry trip from Palau. San Pantaleo village (in the hills) was nice to visit for a morning as well. La Risacca restaurant, just around the corner from the hotel, is amazing. Doesn't look like much from the outside, but inside it's beautiful, with great food. And go to Tavola Azzura in town - cheap and cheerful but great. In all my time in Sardinia I didn't have one bad meal, the food is gorgeous.
reviews.title: Everything was just right

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my partner stayed at this hotel in September 2009. The hotel was great but the weather was awful, it rained 6 days out of 7, just bad luck. We were really lucky as we got an upgraded room as we were supposed to be in the Rotunda. Our room i think was a junior suite and was lovely, very roomy. The food in the hotel was great, i don`t think i have ever eaten so much. You really could eat as much as you want and at the start we went a bit mad but by end of the week, we were so full we could hardly eat anything. Location of the hotel is good as you can have a wee wander to the town. We hired a car as it was so wet and we found that really expensive so if you want to hire a car book this in the UK before you go. We took the bus to Porto Cervo and Baia Sardinia which was good value. To be honest i don`t think i could afford to visit this hotel in the high season but if you get a deal, go it`s great!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: This was our second stay at the Cala di Falco. It is a very pretty hotel with an attractive layout and gardens. It is also a few minutes walk to Cannigione which is a small town with a nice harbour, some bars and beach shops. The beach is not particularly brilliant there however - too close to the main road.
reviews.title: Lovely relaxing hotel

reviews.text: The Staff at the hotel were, for the most part, friendly and polite. We were given a welcome drink on arrival which was lovely as it was incredibly hot there this year. We arrived very early and the hotel did all they could to get the rooms ready as quickly as possible. The rooms themselves were fantastic - really spacious and spotlessly clean with plenty of storage.
reviews.title: Excellent relaxing family holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The baby and mini clubs looked very popular, however my children were not keen on joining in the older club (10 - 14) and I saw very little activity for this age group. There is a room in the basement which has a table tennis table and a couple of old arcade machines but it was not inviting and we never saw anyone in there. They have a new 'card room' by the restaurant. This room used to be the hub for the older children which was great - the new room however seemed to be hardly used and very quiet.
reviews.title: An Island of outstanding beauty

reviews.text: The food was excellent. Breakfasts were fantastic - everything you could want. The buffets were also great in the evening but the restaurant did get very busy so we ate at the Terrace restaurant a couple of times (5 euros per person extra) which was much calmer and very enjoyable.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, Excellent location, didn't want to leave!

reviews.text: We stayed with our daughter (and parents) for the last week in June, in one of the s/c villas - the hotel is spotless and the facilities are very good. The staff were more than helpful and the meals (when we took them) were very very good. Not a low cost resort but an excellent value-for-money resort. The hotel has a cashless (payment card) based system which is a little messy but the whole experience is excellent. The village has a selection of cafes and restaurants suitable for all pockets. The seafood is excellent/pricey but most places also have quality pizzas available for just a few €. Don't expect a party atmosphere. The town is predominantly for tourists from Italy and everyone was polite and respectful. We have stayed in quite a lot of nice resorts and hotels and we found Cala di Falco very difficult to fault.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What an amazing Holiday!!
reviews.title: Fabulous destination and villa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Villa (Giglio) was superb and exceeded our expectations. They had thought of every possible thing we might have wanted and them some (down to a well stocked kitchen, every appliance you could possibly need, beach towels, fluffy dressing gowns and a lovely welcome pack). Even the beds were comfortable which is saying something for me.
reviews.title: Good location to explore the Island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was perfect for exploring the beautiful island and with sea views to die for, local beaches and a fabulous pool we couldn't have asked for me.
reviews.title: Great for families with small children

reviews.text: The staff working for the hotel and villas were exceedingly helpful and efficient. I can't speak more highly of the entire holiday and would highly recommend it to anyone. Infact, If I could afford it i'd move in tomorrow.
reviews.title: great location

aka: Resort Cala Di Falco Hotel Cannigione
description: Resort Cala di Falco Dynamic beauty. The Resort offers three options: the Hotel formula ("Il Borgo" and "La Rotonda"), the Residence and the Villas At the gateway to the Costa Smeralda, just 300 m from the charming small town of Cannigione, with its pleasant small port and a number of shops open year round. One of the best known destinations in Sardinia about 30 minutes from the port and airport of Olbia, it faces the islands of the La Maddalena Archipelago. This hotel, in which particular care has been lavished on architectural detail, with exposed stone, hand-sculpted capitals and stylish small plazas, offers a welcoming Club formula, devoted to the full privacy of its guests. Its strategic position means that guests can reach the most renowned beaches in just a few minutes, not forgetting the high society attractions of the Costa Smeralda or the islands of the Archipelago, just a few minutes boat ride away on the hotel’s launch.
